alert.note: Alert for Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 24 at 1:56PM CST until December 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR OSAGE AND PAWNEE COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 6 PM CST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Osage, and Pawnee counties. * WIND...Southwest 15 to 25 mph, gusting to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...20 to 30 percent. * TEMPERATURE...Low 80s. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
